Adventure.Name: Universal Studios Singapore
Adventure.Description: Go beyond the screen and Ride The Movies™ at Universal Studios Singapore™ at Resorts World™ Sentosa. Experience cutting-edge rides, shows, and attractions based on your favorite blockbuster films and television series.

Adventure.Name: iFly Singapore
Adventure.Description: Experience the thrill of skydiving in one of the world's largest indoor skydiving wind tunnels at iFly Singapore on Sentosa Island.

Adventure.Name: AJ Hackett Sentosa
Adventure.Description: AJ Hackett Sentosa is home to Singapore's first and only bungy tower, giant swing, and skybridge for those seeking a rush of adrenaline and adventure.

Adventure.Name: Mega Adventure Park
Adventure.Description: At Mega Adventure Park, take on the MegaZip, a 450-meter zip line that sends you flying over the jungle canopy of Sentosa Island.
Adventure.Opening Hours: Monday to Thursday: 11am - 6pm, Friday to Sunday: 11am - 6.30pm

Adventure.Name: Forest Adventure Singapore
Adventure.Description: Forest Adventure is Singapore's only treetop obstacle course located at Bedok Reservoir Park, offering a fun and challenging experience for all ages.
Adventure.Opening Hours: Monday: 9.30am - 2pm, Tuesday to Friday: 9.30am - 6pm, Saturday to Sunday/ PH: 9.30am - 6.30pm

Adventure.Name: Singapore Luge
Adventure.Description: Wave House Sentosa is the ultimate beach destination, offering the perfect wave rides for surfing and bodyboarding.
Adventure.Opening Hours: Monday to Thursday and Sunday: 10am - 7.30pm, Friday and Saturday: 10am - 9pm

Adventure.Name: Singapore Wake Park
Adventure.Description: Singapore Wake Park is Singapore’s only cable-ski park, offering wakeboarding and waterskiing for enthusiasts of all levels.

Adventure.Name: Adventure Cove Waterpark
Adventure.Description: Come experience the exhilaration and adrenaline rush of zipping down water slides at Southeast Asia’s only integrated aquatic and marine life park!

Shopping.Name: Orchard Road
Shopping.Description: Singapore's premier shopping street, featuring a wide range of high-end and mid-range retail stores, dining options, and entertainment.

Shopping.Name: VivoCity
Shopping.Description: The largest shopping mall in Singapore, offering a diverse mix of retail, dining, and entertainment options, including a rooftop sky park.

Shopping.Name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands
Shopping.Description: A luxury shopping destination with high-end brands, fine dining, and a spectacular view of the Marina Bay waterfront.

Shopping.Name: Bugis Street Market
Shopping.Description: One of the largest and cheapest places to shop in Singapore, offering a wide variety of fashion, accessories, and souvenirs.

Shopping.Name: Mustafa Centre
Shopping.Description: A 24-hour shopping mall in Little India, known for its vast array of products at competitive prices, from electronics to groceries.

Shopping.Name: ION Orchard
Shopping.Description: A stylish shopping mall on Orchard Road, featuring a mix of luxury and high-street brands, as well as fine dining and an observation deck.

Shopping.Name: Suntec City Mall
Shopping.Description: A major shopping and entertainment complex with a wide range of retail outlets, dining options, and the famous Fountain of Wealth.

Shopping.Name: Haji Lane
Shopping.Description: A vibrant street in Kampong Glam known for its indie boutiques, unique fashion stores, and hip cafes.

Sight-seeing.Name: Marina Bay Sands SkyPark
Sight-seeing.Description: Enjoy panoramic views of Singapore's skyline from the observation deck of the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotel.

Sight-seeing.Name: Gardens by the Bay
Sight-seeing.Description: Explore futuristic gardens, including the Flower Dome, Cloud Forest, and Supertree Grove, with breathtaking landscapes and innovative designs.

Sight-seeing.Name: Merlion Park
Sight-seeing.Description: Visit the iconic Merlion statue, a symbol of Singapore, with stunning views of Marina Bay.

Sight-seeing.Name: Singapore Flyer
Sight-seeing.Description: Ride one of the world's largest observation wheels for a bird's-eye view of the city and beyond.

Sight-seeing.Name: Clarke Quay
Sight-seeing.Description: A riverside quay with a vibrant nightlife, offering a mix of restaurants, bars, and clubs along the Singapore River.
Sight-seeing.Opening Hours: Varies by establishment (generally open from 10am - late)

Sight-seeing.Name: Chinatown
Sight-seeing.Description: Discover the rich heritage and culture of Singapore's Chinese community, with traditional shops, temples, and delicious street food.

Sight-seeing.Name: Little India
Sight-seeing.Description: Immerse yourself in the sights, sounds, and flavors of Singapore's Indian community, with colorful shops, temples, and markets.

Sight-seeing.Name: Haji Lane
Sight-seeing.Description: A narrow alley in Kampong Glam known for its eclectic mix of boutiques, cafes, and vibrant street art.
